turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: So we'll take him with us.  At least 'til we get back to the Hummer.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He'd just slow us down, and drink our water.  And if we ran into any more Iraqis you know he'd sell us out.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Maybe we ought to...you know, bury him. Say some words over him.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You want to say some words?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You're going to burn up in those.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: The white reflects the sun; it keeps you cooler.  That's why they wear them.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Think the Iraqi's killed them all?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Probably shot a few.  Scattered the rest. Murderers.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: When my Shi'ite friends saw that they had shot an American they were very apologetic.  Turns out we've been kicking ass in this little war.  They figure we've finally gotten Saddam off their backs.  They brought me to their camp, cleaned me up, fed me... I'm their new best buddy.  America number one, Joe. But there's something the Shi'ites can't figure out:  They can't figure out why my two buddies, two fellow Americans, left me out in the desert.  They can't seem to figure out what those same two guys were doing in an Iraqi outpost.  It's almost as if they were Iraqi spies, or something.  And I've got to tell you they hate anything that's got to do with the Iraqis.  See how I mean?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We had to take shelter in the checkpoint. Jesus, Wes, I killed the Iraqis in there.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You actually got around to killing someone.  I'm impressed.  I guess you're only half a bitch.

turns.speaker: 1ST VOICE
turns.text: Cortex bonding....possible temporary.  Before you report a possible equipment malfunction, you check the subjects....?

turns.speaker: 1ST VOICE
turns.text: Correct.  Now secure a sinex drop reading.

turns.speaker: 1ST VOICE
turns.text: A sinex drop reading of less then 2000 degrees with an accompanying loss of greater then 350 degrees since admission may indicate....?

turns.speaker: 1ST VOICE
turns.text: See if you can get a reading on tactal retention.  Try to estimate it without a meter reading.

turns.speaker: 1ST VOICE
turns.text: No, evidently you reversed the polarity on his lobal travel. Secure another sinex drop.

turns.speaker: 1ST VOICE
turns.text: 4000 degrees is usually the point of....?

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: Well it's fixed, so you'll have to eat it.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: No, your going to eat it, or it will go to waste.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: What's this?  Why did you change it?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: You know I don't feel well.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: I have to see SEN.  I've just been given a shift change.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: He wants me to come to his quarters.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: A shift change should come through the scheduling office.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: I have to... he's a G-34

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: You don't have to... I don't trust him.  You ought to file a report.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: No, don't make trouble.  It's nothing.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Then why did you bring it up?

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: I didn't.  You asked me about the card.  You're going to get us into trouble.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I've never been under the table before.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: That's not dirt...Can't be dirt.. Dirt is a violation.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: That's not food.  Can't be food.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Now...now, I'm sorry...don't - don't....please.  It's just... I was happy.  Why get me involved? You told SEN that you weren't satisfied with me.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: What?...Oh, no, THX.  That's not true.  Not satisfied?  THX, I need you so much.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: I was so scared...I didn't know what would happen with you...once I started.  I almost let you go on so many times.  It will be worth it, together.  When I was alone, I knew.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: But it's so hopeless...you're so beautiful.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I said what time is it?  How long was I out?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Three!  I'm going to be late for my shift.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: They'll come for me right away if I'm not there.  I have to go.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: Promise...please don't THX leaves the room.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: What are you doing here?  Is anything wrong?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: You're not cleared for this precinct.  Let's cross over first.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: You slipped on a T297 transfer just before lunch, didn't you?

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: On the cervix transfer, you almost lost the T297.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: What do you think you're doing? You're going to get us arrested.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I can't go on like this.  I can't....  I don't just sit around and watch people.  If I make a mistake, it's all over.  You see it every day.  Do you want to see me taken away in pieces?

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: I don't want to lose you.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: If you....if you go back on sedation, you won't feel the same way about me.  You'll report me for drug evasion.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I've got a slip movement to install on my next shift.  I'll never make it the way I am now.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I couldn't turn you in, not now. I....I know I wouldn't!

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: If I take something, you suffer. If I don't, I stuff....

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: I know you can do it without sedation, You can, I know you can.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Then what?  It can't go on forever. You know it can't.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: We could leave, and live in the superstructure....

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: It's all right now, shhhh it's all right.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: They know.  They've been watching us.  I can feel it.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: No one can see us now we're alone.

turns.speaker: LUH
turns.text: Oh, THX... hold me, hold me, THX holds her tightly, tears in his eyes.  They kiss, and LUH hides her head in THX's chest.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: It's wrong; so wrong, what we've done....

turns.speaker: PTO
turns.text: Then why are they holding us here? Why don't they destroy us right away?  Economically, it's not sound at all.  Very much unlike....

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: I've said many times before, and I guess I'll have to repeat it again for your...

turns.speaker: PTO
turns.text: You always manage to avoid the issue:  What's wrong with our present condition?  We're COMFORTABLE and we have plenty of food...I feel absolutely no threat because there is no threat. Why incite trouble?  You should examine your emotions.  It is senseless...

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: What are you talking about? When did you sleep last?  Do you know what your trouble is? You're blind.  You've been here so long you can't see what is happening.  We must unite.  We need unity.  We need action. ) We have come to a time when we must....

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: But we need a creative dissent. Our voices are not joined in any harmonious chorus, but the differences are differences of emphasis, not of fundamentals. Now, the new alignment's greatest need is to communicate with all its elements, rather than march along in parallel line that never converge.  Tomorrow as we focus the new movement more clearly, we will gain a new unity.

turns.speaker: PTO
turns.text: A shelldweller.  They live in the outer shell of the city.  Quite unique, there have been two here before.  They smell.

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: There goes another of your disciples.

turns.speaker: PTO
turns.text: It seems I am destined to endure many frustrations....but at the same time I am secure in the knowledge that the thrust of my studies has been in the right direction, and that even if it remains incomplete, my search has not been in vain.

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: I thought you were through with it!

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: We cannot stay here and allow ourselves to be destroyed.  You can work with us.  An organized plan of escape must be devised first.  Could you see anything?  You want to leave.  You're not like them.  You must have left something, or someone.

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: What's going on....what are you doing?

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: But you can't.  We must escape.

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: I can just barely see him.  I think he's leaving.

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: He's coming back for the rest of us.  He can't make it alone.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: I wonder how far he went.  He's gathered invaluable information out there.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: Ask him about the air.  He looks out of breath.

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: That's the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: It may seem ridiculous to the untrained mind, but if you were able to interpret the calculations you would see that an apparent paradox is actually a perfect and elegant system in concept and design.

turns.speaker: NIN
turns.text: We must escape.  We have plans. We can leave.  We must wait until...

turns.speaker: PTO
turns.text: I can't see him at all.  He's been destroyed.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: No, look!  Three degrees from the central azimuth.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: How far did you go?  Was it cold?

turns.speaker: PTO
turns.text: You have nothing to fear.  You're safe again.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: Out of a random selection of 150 locations with 150 possible sightings, there were 146 absolute negatives and four conditionals, most of which occurred in the early familiarization stages of the experiment and can be largely discounted.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: On the contrary!  It absolutely proves what I have always felt. We are located in an apparently uniform space with no visible limits.  We are just now beginning to push back the clouds of ignorance and perceive the truth.  We must continue the search.

turns.speaker: TWA
turns.text: No one could have imagined anything one-thousandth as fantastic as the sober facts uncovered by patient inquiry.  This world is in a state of static-mobility:  we are at the same time moving and standing still.

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: I'm sure it's warmer in her than outside, though.  I haven't been out yet, but it usually is...the control is fouled...

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Why did you have LUH come here?

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: I want you for my roommate.

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: It will be good for both of us. I've got it all arranged.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I don't understand. Living....selection is computed. You can't... What have you done to LUH?  She was here..

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: We had a long talk and she agreed that it would be a good idea for you to switch.  She felt that you had not been accurately mated to her in the first place... You're upsetting yourself.  Would you like something?

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: Don't say that.  You look...  You're not well.

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: I won't have another mate like ONA.  You rate very high in sanitation.  I've checked.  In fact, I am surprised that you were ever matched with LUH.  Her ratings are very erratic - you know what I mean.  We'll be happy.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: What are you doing here?  You're not cleared for this area!

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: You know I have a way with the computers.  I can clear myself for any area.....almost.

turns.speaker: SEN
turns.text: Listen to me....You have no need to distrust me.  We're going....

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Get out of here, Leave me alone.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Lost SEN!  He'll never find us.

turns.speaker: SRT
turns.text: ...it doesn't matter.  The rest of it just didn't happen.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: What are you talking about. How do you know?  I need her!  I need her.  She needs me.  I've got to get to her.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: We'll never make it through that mainway...I wonder what happened to SEN.  I'm crazy!  This whole thing is crazy...What am I doing?  My mind is full of so many things I can't think of anything, anymore.  Who are you?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: What kind of answer is that?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: You have to!....I'm 1138 THX Magnum manipulator 347 cell 94107 Precinct 3 Residence:  Level 6421 Complex 12 Ramp 5.  Roommate 3417 LU...H.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Must be an expressway.... You don't have to stay here, you know....

turns.speaker: SRT
turns.text: What have you done, Cut your hand?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I'm all right THX rises and they begin to walk along the passageway. At the end of the hall is a small metal door, a sign read "Level 842CON G, Division of Plastic, Vendable manufacturing stations" the door is jammed and it is difficult to open.  Finally the latch snaps and the door swings open.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: Would you like part of this? ....It's not much.

turns.speaker: SRT
turns.text: This one has eyes.  Why did they leave your eyes? Could you ever....

turns.speaker: SRT
turns.text: Soon he'll be a plastic cube.

turns.speaker: SRT
turns.text: I'm only trying to help you.

turns.speaker: SRT
turns.text: Just look at all those people.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: ....going well.  How could I be so wrong.  SCO 1202 cross wired a 904.  He's been receiving extra credit.  He offered me some.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: I did not accept any.  I...  I wanted... to.  But I didn't. You know I didn't.  Don't you?

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: My mate has been acting very strange.  I can't explain it.....but.  I haven't been feeling very well myself.  I don't know, maybe it's me.  I needed an SP9 last night.  I feel as if something odd were happening to me. Something....

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: ....I'm taking SP5, but it doesn't seem strong enough.  I have a hard time concentrating.  Please forgive me, I slipped on....

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You are a true believer.  Blessings of the state, blessings of the masses.  Thou art a subject of the divine.  Created in the image of man, by the masses, for the masses. Let us be thankful we have an occupation to fill.  Work hard; increase production; prevent accidents, and be happy.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: ....with me?  What am I to her or she to me?  Nothing.  She's an ordinary roommate.  I..I share...

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: ...rooms with her.  Our relationship is normal, conforming.  We share nothing but space.  What is she doing to...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You are engaged in an unauthorized procedure.  Check cybernetic manual F-45.  If you do no have an F-45, you are in violation.  This is a double A restricted precinct. Remain where you are.  Authorities will arrive shortly.

turns.speaker: THX
turns.text: You should know better than that!

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I'm looking for the Bomb Squad.

turns.speaker: BEV
turns.text: There out on a call, perhaps I can help you-

turns.speaker: BEV
turns.text: f 2600 block of Lakefront. A limousine. But, I-

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: We just got a bomb threat upstairs.

turns.speaker: BEV
turns.text: One partial from the handle matches the suspect from last night. Name's Carl Taylor. Long record of arson, assault, the works. The other print - we got nothing from our data base or the FBI or CIA... still waiting for Interpol.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Patch me through to the Bomb Squad.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Off a girl's wrist. A suspect...

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: High-grade det cord. This girl, either she's got strange taste in jewelry or she's into serious demolition.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Sorry about that.  That's an inch of the stuff, imagine what the whole thing'd do.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: We can start in the area where the robbery occurred.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: When you need us, you love us, when you don't, we're shunned by the rest of the department.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: We've got one hour. Are you coming or not?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: That cop who bought it... you didn't tell us he was your partner.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: This isn't bumper cars, it's brain surgery. You wanna work with us, you do it our way, understand?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Be cool around my men, they don't trust strangers. And try not to swear so much, it's unattractive.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: By the way, I'm Glass. This is T.J., and Pooch.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: We don't use the b-word. Bad luck.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: So you're the "Device Squad"... and you defuse "devices"?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: I.R.A. device. Deadliest class of tickers in existence. Computerized, multiple sensors, booby traps, the works. First showed up in a series of I.R.A. bombings in London couple years ago. One of their boys tripped it on himself and they went back to a less complicated timers. The Girl, is she Irish?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: She's not talking. But, she could be. So, obviously, you've seen one of these devices before?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Nice performance back there. Where'd you learn that, Mike Ditka Sensitivity Seminar?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: No you look, mister! First, you don't go calling my men names. It's bad for morale. Second, us "punks" happen to know a heck of alot more about police work than any vice cop ever did.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: The place has already be combed. Forensics pulled over a hundred sets of prints inside.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Then let's go see what they missed.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: So what were they doing here?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I don't know. You tell me?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: An abandoned machine shop... nice place to build devices. Low rent, too. But, you and Rice ruined their perfect hideout.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Redstone's the army training center in Alabama where they send the cream of the crop to learn about tickers.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Cream of the crop, huh? You?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: Top of my class at West Point, thank you very much. Then off to Redstone. First half of the course we learned how to build devices... second half, we'd take them apart. Everything from firecrackers to hydrogen bombs.

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: There were a few guys in my class with names like John Smith, Bill Jones. I'd see them up ahead in the hall, call their name, but they wouldn't turn around. C.I.A. Funny thing, they'd always disappear after the first half of the course.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Just how easy is it to build a... device?

turns.speaker: GLASS
turns.text: With a little training, you could go into a house and just from stuff in the bathroom and kitchen make something that'd finish off that alleged car of yours. Heck, didn't you ever watch MacGyver?
